programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Locker in the West
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at locker auctions in Santa Ana, where Darrell makes a find that could mean another huge win for the Gambler.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones set their sights on an undertaker's tool kit, scuba diving equipment and a shark cage at an auction in Oxnard, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff attends an auction in Ventura County, California, where he spots a vintage suitcase and other items with potential in a unit full of office furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A bidding war erupts between the buyers as they attend the latest round of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle accompanies Mike on a pick while Frank looks after the shop, and the first-time picker strikes gold when she spots a derelict hotel filled with treasures.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy struggles to make up for lost time, while RJ pushes himself too hard during the last days of the season, and ends up suffering from exhaustion.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr heads to Cincinnati, Ohio, where the groundkeepers of the Great American Ballpark request that he catches a critter which has created a den in their field.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a 1920s doll of aviator Charles Lindbergh and a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries, beginning with a rock bearing a cryptic design that was discovered in Roswell, New Mexico, in 2004.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether aliens lie at the heart of Earth's most famous mysteries. In this instalment, he looks at the new clues narrowing down the possible location of Atlantis, suggesting that Plato's mysterious island was the home of an advanced civilisation.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Cindy buys a shirt for Rick that is not to his taste, while Bogart puts his dad on an extremely healthy diet - much to his displeasure.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Keep Your Friends Close and the Veterans Closer
programme.desc: Paul and Bogart take aim at auction veterans Cindy and Tim, while Ursula is on the lookout for items that cater to men.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a theme park during a clear-out and later discover some shocking news about a collection of circus posters.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Waxahachie, where wood expert Moe Prigoff meets his match.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Poor weather causes trouble for the bargain-hunting bidders as they attend auctions in Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: You Bought It, You Break It
programme.desc: Fortune seems to favour Moe and Mary when they visit Mesquite, Nevada, the town where Ricky and Bubba experienced their infamous losing streak.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go head to head in a series of tense locker auctions in Oak Cliff, where they bid for a unit of antique electronics and a strange vaudeville curio.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba are cautiously optimistic as they head to auctions in Mesquite, Nevada, a location that has not proven to be particularly fruitful for them in the past.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A locker at an auction in Arlington catches Vic's eye, but Bubba suspects it could have been used for shady dealings.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys start looking for a new employee to cover the night shift, and examine a collection of antique cast-iron piggy banks and a triple-barrelled gun.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys interview applicants for the night shift position and examine a valuable first edition of David Thoreau's classic book Walden.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a 1920s doll of aviator Charles Lindbergh and a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to make a deal on a guitar signed by Crosby, Stills & Nash, and also examines a pair of bomb fins from the Second World War.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The force is strong as the gang encounter a treasure trove of Star Wars related memorabilia, including an original 'Revenge of the Jedi' poster, and a Jabba the Hutt Play-Doh set..

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.sub-title: What is a Picker? And Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Find out what an Irish picker is and learn the history of Ireland through interesting objects..

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Ghostly Regulars At Haunted Pubs & More
programme.desc: Take a creepy look at the spirits haunting Britain's pubs, as well as a mystery monster seen swimming in the Thames.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor and mystery buff Rob Lowe and his family explore extraordinary sites, heading to Preston Castle, a former reformatory school for boys in Ione, California.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Peril strikes during a daring dive threatening to sideline Kevin and his team just as they begin their search of Lake Michigan.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Historian and writer Dan Jones tells the epic story of the rival dynasties that forged the history of medieval and early modern Europe..

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Tim Vine attempts a risky impersonation, Alex Horne receives a gift from Liza Tarbuck, and the recipient of the Taskmaster's golden bonce trophy is revealed.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian, writer and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with stand-up Ross Noble and journalist Mona Chalabi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Writer-presenter Clive Anderson, The One Show host Alex Jones and actor-comedian Jack Whitehall compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include British-themed bars in foreign countries, shared tables, deer, seagulls and metrosexuality.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people in Newcastle, Belfast, Weston-super-Mare and Edinburgh to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people in Newcastle, Weston-super-Mare, Glasgow and Whitby to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: A Rolls Royce for Omar Sharif is wrapped in creamy white and chrome rose gold, which mixes classic styling and a state-of-the-art chrome wrap.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni suggests a chrome pink wrap for a rare supercar being readied for a car rally, but owners Mark and Steve needs some serious persuasion.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle spends too much on the remains of a Native American chief, but Frank hatches an ambitious plan to cover their losses.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank takes a wrong turn when making a delivery and ends up appearing on a quiz show and stumbling on a vintage motorcycle.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenter Claudia Winkleman, broadcaster Clive Anderson, comedian Jason Manford and comedienne Miranda Hart join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. Stacey finally agrees to return to Billericay with her beau, prompting his proud mum Pamela to set about cleaning the house from top to bottom. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness travel to Ethiopia, where they test cars to see how they can endure in the searing heat. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness present an electric cars special, each taking up the challenge of constructing a battery-powered sports car on a budget. Plus, Chris takes the Tesla Model 3 for a spin on the test track. Plus, Danny Boyle and Himesh Patel, director and star of fantasy comedy Yesterday, drop into the studio.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are strong-armed into organising a Christmas variety show to raise money for their children's school. However, things prove to be far from plain sailing, as quality acts are worryingly thin on the ground and an animal impersonator as the only confirmed performer. Who can the duo turn to - surely not Toby and uptight wife Anna? With raw egg-juggling and some knife throwing for good measure, what could possibly go wrong - especially in a live instalment of this award-winning sitcom from 2018? Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden star.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Comedy game show hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster. Jamali Maddis, Laura Lexx, Rosie Jones and Joe Lycett are posed absurd hypothetical situations.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites Jimmy Carr, Sophie Duker and Zoe Lyons to see if they can help him understand the modern world.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies reached the last great natural barrier between their forces and the German heartland. If they could get across the River Rhine, the war would be won.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Hitler's Olympics: The Boys of '36
programme.desc: The story of the 1936 Olympics held in Berlin, revealing how the games led to Nazi Germany gaining international praise as a nation that had triumphed following the Depression.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Tudors
programme.sub-title: Henry VIII - Rise of a Dynasty
programme.desc: Tracy Borman takes a closer look at the rituals and routines of life in the Tudor courts, beginning with attitudes to sex at the beginning of Henry VIII's reign.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Tudors
programme.desc: Tracy Borman examines the reign of Henry VIII, revealing his interests, clothing, taste in food and the accidents he survived during his life.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Tudors
programme.desc: Tracy Borman explores the life of Elizabeth I, looking into her relationships with her closest attendants and her attitudes to, and treatment of, other women.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: The lives of some of history's most iconic kings and queens. Tracy Borman explores Queen Victoria's relationship with her husband and her eldest son.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a cave-diving team into the largest unexplored cave network on Earth. Below the jungles of Mexico, they push further and deeper than anyone has gone before.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a cave-diving team into the largest unexplored cave network on Earth. Below the jungles of Mexico, they push further and deeper than anyone has gone before.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: You've Got a Friend: The Carole King Story
programme.desc: The award-winning US singer gives an account of her life, looking back on her upbringing in Brooklyn, and the subsequent success she enjoyed as part of husband-and-wife songwriting team Goffin and King in the 1960s, including the creation of global hits Take Good Care of My Baby, The Locomotion and Will You Love Me Tomorrow. By 1970, Carole was divorced and had moved to Los Angeles, where she created her classic solo album Tapestry. Now in her seventies, she reveals herself to be as much an environmental activist as a musician, lobbying Congress in defence of the wildlife and eco-systems in her beloved Idaho.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: The highs and lows of Prince Harry and Prince William's roles in the forces, featuring an interview with Harry in which he discusses a planned secret deployment in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: The mysterious story of Howard Irwin, whose suitcase was aboard the Titanic, despite the fact that he wasn't, and the story behind the schoolbooks of Edgar Samuel Andrew and the chilling statement he wrote in a letter to his friend.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The appeal of a man convicted of murder and mutilation forces Grace to question the decision she made on the case 30 years ago. Someone who appears to be copying his chilling tactics sends the team footage of a new victim having his finger cut off. At the same time, Grace receives threats and a macabre package - a jar of pickled, severed fingers. Sue Johnston and Trevor Eve star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Crabtree and John are transporting a convicted axe murderer to prison when she escapes to exact revenge on those who testified against her.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: An alleged sexual assault requires delicate handling. The boat where the attack took place belongs to a friend of the Commissioner, forcing the detectives to go undercover at a fancy dress party as they attempt to arrest their suspect. With only circumstantial evidence and a victim of unreliable character, Ray surprises his colleagues by proving he has a gentler side, gaining the confidence of a young witness.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene comes up against a socialist feminist group when a man's death he initially treated as suicide becomes the subject of a murder inquiry. Chris uses the arrest of every member as an opportunity to impress Shaz with his knowledge of women's issues, while Ray dates a communist. An intriguing code found by Alex and deciphered by the desk sergeant leads the team closer to the truth.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A respected Polish-born doctor is prosecuted for his alleged involvement in Nazi war crimes during the Second World War, forcing victims of persecution to relive their harrowing experiences in concentration camps. Kavanagh finds it difficult to remain professionally detached from such an emotive case and discovers that, after 50 years, witness testimony is not always reliable. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Frederick Treves, Warren Mitchell and Peter Firth.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Newcastle answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survivalist and adventurer continues his journey through rural Australia in search of its remarkable landscapes, extraordinary wildlife and the people who manage to survive in its wilderness. In the nation's Northern Territory in the waterways of Kakadu, Ray encounters the fearsome salt-water crocodile, the largest of which can exceed six metres in length. He also stays with an Aboriginal family whose members share the secrets of farming with fire and creating meals with ingredients procured from the Bush.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's challenge will see him attempt to escape from a helicopter simulator underwater. Has he got what it takes to be submerged?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is auditioning for a circus troop, but he is actually in a professional wrestling ring, in the middle of a fight!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is in the subway but actually, he's in a cave. Running into Weasel, he thinks he's lost and decides to help him find his way..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has reduced the size of the moon in order to model it in his own image. But Magoo thinks it's a dinosaur egg ready to hatch!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes Mrs. Wicket's house-mate when he suffers a flea infestation. Will they get on?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max next travel to Castle Bishopbrook to visit a distant relative who's royalty.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: While doing her chores around the hotel, Mavis mistakes truth bugs for bed bugs.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Coronation Street star Beverley Callard, chefs Nick Nairn and Asma Khan, and food writers James and Paul Anderson, aka the Two Chubby Cubs, while wine expert Oz Clarke provides more helpful tips.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott embarks on a journey across the Mediterranean on a 44ft catamaran, preparing a variety of delicious recipes along the way. In this first edition, skipper Jean-Hughes teaches him the basics of sailing, and they drop anchor in a crystal-clear cove on the island of Lavezzi, where Ainsley tries his hand at paddle-boarding. The chef then prepares seafood skewers with pepperonata, and a quick and tasty Corsican mint omelette.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: The sunny summer season continues, as the Richardsons celebrate a christening at the Cathedral, Jeremy and Stuart have a big performance and Dean Sarah has her portrait painted. Siriol Jenkins narrates.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. When local woman Sonia Woodley is stabbed to death in the churchyard two years after the death of her husband, bespoke tailor Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, and the village begins to reveal its secrets. Detective drama, guest starring James Wilby, Gwyneth Strong and Karl Davies (formerly Emmerdale's Robert Sugden), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five team-mates from Peterborough Amputee Football Club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Sean Fletcher and Ryan Thomas to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to 1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Nottingham.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents highlights from the spinning-chair singing contest, Revisiting the coaches' favourite Blind Auditions and featuring some of the most memorable performances.

programme.title: Safe House (2012)
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: Rewind The Party Classics
programme.desc: We're all about good times and good tunes! Get in the party mood as we rewind the ultimate party tunes to get you on the dancefloor.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Every Number 1 Of The 80s
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces a musical marathon through every chart-topping record of the 90s.

programme.title: Relight The 90s

programme.title: Massive Chart Hits
programme.desc: Chart topping hit after chart topping hit! We've got the best of the best right here.

programme.title: World's Greatest... Singers!

programme.title: Happy Birthday Lady Gaga
programme.desc: It's Lady Gaga's birthday! To celebrate we've got ll her biggest videos back to back! Happy Birthday Lady G.

programme.title: 50 Biggest Beats Of The 10s
programme.desc: From Kendrick to Migos, Breezy to Guetta, Andrea Zara cranks up the volume to some of the biggest bangers of the Twenty Tens.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Empire State Building/Extracting Copper/Making a Car
programme.desc: How the mast on top of the Empire State Building is repaired, and the techniques involved in extracting copper from the world's largest mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China revisit the last eight cars they transformed, highlighting the best and the worst among their many buys, as well as their most inventive restorations.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Mick Cooke's mining operation grinds to a halt when the conveyor belt rips on a vital piece of machinery. In a desperate need for cash, Mick heads out of town on another job.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Pilot Pen Bike and Ducati Bike
programme.desc: The Orange County Choppers team joins forces with manufacturer Ducati to create a customised version of one of the Italian company's bikes.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Chris wants the 1950 F1 Truck he drove in High School, but he also wants to upgrade to a V8 Flathead - is this a bigger challenge than expected?.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of less than pleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how ceramic fireplaces and parking garage floor slabs are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Oil Pressure Sensors and Large Format Printing
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how oil pressure sensors are made and neck restraints are manufactured.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Captain Andy Hillstrand returns to discover the Time Bandit is in disarray, while Jake Anderson gets ready to captain the Saga for the first time.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: The documentary series explores how Alaska's Coast Guard manage to negotiate risky waters to maintain buoys standing three stories tall. Plus, construction of a steel ferry.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Porsche 924 in an attempt to make it roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue their project to make a classic Porsche 924 fit for the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for 5,000, hoping Edd China will be able to work his magic on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, improving the roof seal and spraying it black. Mike Brewer then tries to maximise its price.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to purchase a Lotus Elise, but is unsure how to add value to the car and enlists mechanic Edd China's help.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Porsche Boxster for 1,000 - despite it having seized brakes and mould on its roof. Expert mechanic Edd China tries to determine the cause of the faults so the pair can make the necessary repairs and trade it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Porsche 993 Targa to renovate, and finds the cheapest one in the country.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China are excited to get their hands on a Porsche 944 Turbo, but the restoration does not run smoothly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue to restore the Porsche 944 Turbo, using all their skills to overhaul the sports car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: Namibia's Dog-Headed Pig Monster: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: Paul 'Mungo' Mungeam visits Namibia to capture on film the 'dog-headed pig monster', a predator that is said to prey on livestock and village children like a vampire.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen dodge rockfalls in a potentially deadly new mine. The Fire Crew closes in on a new deposit of precious black opal, while the Boulder Boys struggle to drain their opal pit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead work on a 1964 Falcon Ranchero, one of the first utility vehicles, but this particular example is suffering under a coat of cheap black paint.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Devon, Drew Pritchard rummages through a heap railway items collected over 30 years by a local enthusiast. He then digs out treasure at a recently closed glove factory in Yeovil.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an amazing collection of wicker in the Somerset levels and is smitten by an Orkney chair. In Glasgow, he finds an easel that's a work of art.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.sub-title: Death on the Staten Island Ferry
programme.desc: An investigation into an event of October 2003, when a ferry between Manhattan and Staten Island crashed into a pier, killing 11 people and injuring many more.

programme.title: Flight 370: The Missing Links
programme.desc: Documentary in which some of the foremost thinkers in aviation and security explore key questions surrounding the March 2014 disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370, which garnered worldwide attention and generated widespread speculation about how the events unfolded. The documentary considers how it is possible to lose track of an airliner, while industry experts analyse the evidence and offer suggestions to prevent it from happening again.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Happy Mondays singer Shaun Ryder careers through his past in a shocking yellow banger, a luxury German sports car and a rare hot hatch that he has not seen for 20 years.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: DJ, composer and artist Goldie revisits his old stomping grounds in a Japanese hatchback, overcooks a 1980s dream machine and discovers that even Italian supercars can let you down.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of Tanveer Iqbal. Spurned mistress Zatoon Bibi was jailed for life after being found guilty of killing her lover and putting his body in the boot of his car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when they receive a call from a man, who claims his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy reveals that the wound could not have been self-inflicted.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When forensics investigate the murder of an American woman, they suspect a serial killer might be on the loose.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2012, young entrepreneur Terry Porter was found dead by his neighbour. There was no forensic evidence or witnesses, but surveillance footage was relied on for answers.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Cindy Borton, who was found stabbed to death in her Iowa home. Detectives suspected those closest to her, before a note left at the site of an arson fire turned the investigation on its head.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Forensic evidence is used to confirm suspicions a patrolman was responsible for the rape and murder of a woman on a California highway.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Animal welfare officers working for the Michigan Humane Society recall cases in which animals made amazing recoveries.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Coffs Harbour where he visits Dolphin Marine Magic, and explores one of the greatest friendships between man and animal.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and Diane help find matching dresses for two brides marrying each other, while Amy returns for her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Thre is excitement for both the brides and Randy, who's going back to his bridal design roots. Jenni Pulos has a surprise for her friend, bride Monica.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A three-day-old kitten with a badly twisted leg needs a series of splints to save her, and female loggerhead turtles are in the midst of laying eggs, and some have begun to hatch.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Featuring Jennifer and daughter Marissa, who have a co-dependent relationship, putting both of their lives in jeopardy, with a combined weight of over 900lbs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Featuring Jennifer and daughter Marissa, who have a co-dependent relationship, putting both of their lives in jeopardy, with a combined weight of over 900lbs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Suffering from flesh-eating bacteria and weighing almost 800lbs, Charity relies on her family for support. When bad news threatens her weight loss, can she carry on?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Laura, who has used food to cope with her emotions for too long. Confined to a wheelchair, she depends upon her husband and mother to survive, but now wants to turn her life around.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The investigation into 31-year-old Billy Smolinski's disappearance in 2004, which followed the discovery that girlfriend Madeleine Gleason had cheated on him. In 2012, Gleason sued Smolinski's mother and sister claiming they harassed, defamed and falsely accused her of involvement. However, police believe Smolinski was killed by someone related to Gleason, a suspect who has since died.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and her husband visit the salon to find a gown for their 10th anniversary vow renewal, while Jodee wants to look sexy on her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Candice is shopping with her mother, with three weeks to go until her wedding, while Jacy arrives at the salon with an entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: You're Sexy and You Know It
programme.desc: Belly-dancing paralegal Sahar has her fitting, while Aimee goes in search of a tight dress with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stella brings along an entourage ahead of her Greek wedding, while Carli arrives for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle shares the spotlight with her mother, Afrodite argues with her mum over fashion and Lindsey wants hers to attend the fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie's sister persuades her to ditch the tomboy look, Courtney searches for a ball gown and Jennifer orders a dress too small for her to make her lose weight.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: A police officer wants to talk to someone they failed to save, and Theresa performs a reading inside a cryogenic freezing chamber.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa gatecrashes Victoria's speed dating evening and performs readings for the other singles. She also manages to convince a sceptic that her abilities are genuine.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: An attempt to help a pair of brothers whose hoarding habits have made them a nightmare for their landlord. If their compulsion cannot be curbed, they will end up being evicted.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The medic considers the case of a 42-year-old waiter who collapsed and died while leaving the restaurant where he worked. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her bathroom floor.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: An in-depth look at a murderer who seemingly paralleled the fictional character Patrick Bateman in American Psycho, hiding behind designer clothing and expensive sunglasses.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The disappearance of 21-year-old Noel Alkaramla, who vanished just before Thanksgiving 2015. In November 2017, her stepfather Johnny Oquendo was put on trial for her murder.
